channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: On the Hucclecote Road, travelling towards Gloucester, but before the M5 bridge. It is beyond the turning to Bird Road and yes it has painted lines but I am fed up with trying to report this problem. I must inform you that having told you of this problem if I hear or learn of a cyclist being involved in an accident at this point I will report you to the relevant authorities. This is a very dangerous pothole for cyclists of which I am one. Finally this website is so difficult to use and as I type out this message I can only see the last few words which again is indicative of a poorly designed website . If you wish to call me to discuss this my telephone number is (01452) 611614., 10th January
item.description:
Hucclecote Road going into Gloucester before the M5 bridge. The pothole is beyond the turning to bird Road. I have to say that this process has been very time-consuming and the cynic in me says that this is deliberate to ensure that people do not report these problems. They simply give up because of the time taken.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle causing obstruction to junction, 10th January
item.description:
Blue convertible car left on junction of Guan Road and Bowood Drive. It's blocking the view at the junction, has multiple flat tyres and has been leaking fluids on to the road surface. Also surface rust and scratches visible with possibly an attempted entry by unknown overnight recently. Has been abandoned since early November with no evidence of anyone monitoring it or owning it nearby?!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Guan Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bad road markings, 10th January
item.description:
Cars exiting old Gloucester Road wanting to go straight on, cut across traffic turning right and on a number of occasions have nearly come in contact with each other in the centre of the junction. I feel this could easily be remedied by changing the left-hand lane to just left, and the right hand lane to straight on and turn right, so traffic uses one lane for both directions

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Multiple potholes that will damage wheels/suspension, 10th January
item.description:
On the roundabout. Unavoidable as you turn right from Up Hatherley to Shurdington Road. Affects ability to Brake as cars from the left fail to give way on the roundabout. Been there for ages and whoever inspected it clearly doesn't have to pay for his own maintenance as it causes damage to vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The highway is directly up against the foundations of an exsisting Cotswold Boundry wall of a property Shepherds Cottage. The surface of the highway has been eroded by the constant flow of storm water along the surfaces. A repair is urgently required as it is undermining the foundation of the boundary wall which could cause it to collapse. Highways own the road up to the boundary wall - there is no verge., 10th January
item.description:
The erosion is directly outside Shepherd’s Cottage Shipton Oliffe. It runs all the way along the frontage boundary wall on the highway itself.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
